channel.title: SumPowerMiner Error
channel.description:
I tried using Sumillion's latest version of SumPowerMiner, but now I get an error every time I try and run (unlike when I had the older version).
The error is something like [RUNTIME ERROR] on line 35 on (My desktop).
Line 34 is the player select (Players[0].name :='namehere'). I'm pretty sure I have everything else set up. Anyone feel like helping me?

item.title: SumPowerMiner Error
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Oh xP, Sorry, I mustn’t of been very alert >_<
I was in a hurry since dinner was nearly done.

Thanks =D

Read full topic

item.title: SumPowerMiner Error
item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

Lol…wrong script…(That’s Rimmington miner/banker, I was using regular powerminer here.

Anways, latest downloaded. I’ll have to test tomorrow though…

And Rep for you for being so helpful.

Read full topic

item.title: SumPowerMiner Error
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

http://www.srl-forums.com/forum/attachment.php?attachmentid=6160&d=1188144845

In SRL 4, String1, 2 & 3 are just Strings[0] etc… It’s all an array now incase 3 isnt enough.

The link above is the download to his newest version which I presume is SRL 4 Compatible

Read full topic

item.title: SumPowerMiner Error
item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

Darn Runescape and there interface changes…

Joined srl-forums (with you as referrer), downloaded, installed properly (took awhile to get everything in the right folder), Just as I think everything is dandy…Line 38: [Error] (12882:12): Unknown identifier ‘STRING1’ in script PLACEHERE.

Sigh…Scar is troublesome, you know that? I can’t see how you stand to mess with it all day. Haha…

Read full topic

item.title: SumPowerMiner Error
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

3.81 isn’t compatible with the new RuneScape interface xP
You pretty much need SRL 4 now or no scripts will work o_O

Read full topic

item.title: SumPowerMiner Error
item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

No, 3.81. Should I get 4 Beta?

item.title: SumPowerMiner Error
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

That shouldn’t even compile for you O_O

Are you using SRL BETA 4?
(http://www.srl-forums.com/forum/showthread.php?t=17095)

Read full topic

item.title: SumPowerMiner Error
item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

Yep. Sure can.

[code]procedure DeclarePlayers;
begin
HowManyPlayers := 6;//MAKE SURE THIS ONE IS CORRECT!

CurrentPlayer := StartPlayer;
NumberOfPlayers(HowManyPlayers);

Players[0].Name :=‘Username’;
Players[0].Pass :=‘Password’;
Players[0].Nick :=‘sern’; // 3-4 letters from your name, NO CAPITALS (that includes the first character)
Players[0].String1 :=‘Iron’; //Will be mined most (unless RandomlyChooseRock is set)
Players[0].String2 :=‘Copper’;//Will be mined less, unless ^
Players[0].String3 :=‘Tin’; //Will be mined even less, unless ^
Players[0].Active:= True;

Players[1].Name :=‘Username’;
Players[1].Pass :=‘Password’;
Players[1].Nick :=‘sern’;
Players[1].String1 :=‘Coal’;
Players[1].String2 :=‘Gold’;
Players[1].String3 :=‘Iron’;
Players[1].Active:= True;

Players[2].Name :=‘Username’;
Players[2].Pass :=‘Password’;
Players[2].Nick :=‘sern’;
Players[2].String1 :=‘Copper’;
Players[2].String2 :=‘Tin’;
Players[2].String3 :=‘Iron’;
Players[2].Active:= True;

Players[3].Name :=‘Username’;
Players[3].Pass :=‘Password’;
Players[3].Nick :=‘sern’;
Players[3].String1 :=‘Addy’;
Players[3].String2 :=‘Mith’;
Players[3].String3 :=‘Gold’;
Players[3].Active:= True;

Players[4].Name :=‘Username’;
Players[4].Pass :=‘Password’;
Players[4].Nick :=‘sern’;
Players[4].String1 :=‘Coal’;
Players[4].String2 :=‘Copper’;
Players[4].String3 :=‘Tin’;
Players[4].Active:= True;

Players[5].Name :=‘Username’;
Players[5].Pass :=‘Password’;
Players[5].Nick :=‘sern’;
Players[5].String1 :=‘Iron’;
Players[5].String2 :=‘Addy’;
Players[5].String3 :=‘Coal’;
Players[5].Active:= True;
end;[/code]

I remember the older SPM had a form (which made it easy), but he has taken it out of this version.

Read full topic

@Nashi wrote:
